subject: [PATCH 1/2] mm: vmalloc: streamline vmalloc memory accounting

reviews.author: Johannes Weiner (author)
reviews.summary: The author is addressing a concern about the removal of the custom memcg counter for vmalloc memory accounting. They eliminated this custom counter and replaced it with a single, consolidated accounting call in the vmalloc code.

reviews.author: Shakeel Butt
reviews.summary:
Reviewer Shakeel Butt pointed out that the patch does not handle the case where the VMALLOC_TOTAL is zero, which can occur in non-MMU configurations, and requested a check to be added to handle this scenario.

Reviewer Shakeel Butt pointed out that the function mod_node_page_state() requires a struct pglist_data pointer as its first argument, but the patch is using page_pgdat(page) instead, which should be corrected to maintain proper locking and functionality.

Reviewer Shakeel Butt approved the patch after additional fixes were applied and added an Acked-by tag.
sentiment_signals: patch needs additional handling for non-MMU config
reviews.raw_body:
On Fri, Feb 20, 2026 at 02:10:34PM -0500, Johannes Weiner wrote:
[...]

---

mod_node_page_state() takes 'struct pglist_data *pgdat', you need to use
page_pgdat(page) as first param.

---

Same here.

Acked-by: Shakeel Butt <shakeel.butt@linux.dev>

2026-02-20.patch_summary: This patch streamlines memory accounting for vmalloc by replacing a custom atomic counter with a vmstat counter, which provides per-node data and prepares the system for cleaning up memcg (memory cgroup) accounting. The changes affect several files, including mm/vmalloc.c, include/linux/mmzone.h, and include/linux/vmalloc.h. The patch updates the way memory usage is reported in /proc/meminfo and introduces a new node stat item to track vmalloc memory usage. This change aims to simplify and improve the accuracy of memory accounting for vmalloc allocations.

reviews.author: Uladzislau Rezki
reviews.summary: reviewer suggested moving *_node_page_stat() calls to a single location in vm_area_alloc_pages(), and also proposed invoking mod_node_page_state on high-order pages before splitting them
reviews.raw_body:
Can we move *_node_page_stat() to the end of the vm_area_alloc_pages()?

Or mod_node_page_state in first place should be invoked on high-order
page before split(to avoid of looping over small pages afterword)?

I mean it would be good to place to the one solid place. If it is possible
of course.

--
Uladzislau Rezk

reviews.author: Johannes Weiner (author)
reviews.summary: Author acknowledged a mistake in their patch and apologized for it, indicating no fix is planned as the issue was due to a lack of incremental compilation.
reviews.raw_body:
Good catch, my apologies. Serves me right for not compiling
incrementally.
